unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions

Class GroupingAtPositionAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaGOAP.GoapAction
      • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.BaseAction
        • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.GroupingAtPositionAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroupableAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupingAtPositionActionBaseEntrance

    public abstract class GroupingAtPositionAction
extends BaseAction
    GroupingAtPositionAction.java --- A general grouping Action with which a Unit can group together at a certain spot with other allies (One uniform grouping Spot!).

    Note:
    The grouping performed by this Action is actual grouping of Units (!), not a general unified execution of Actions.

    This Action is executed exactly once for each Unit whose "groupingNeeded"-flag is set. Once a certain Unit limit is reached, the Action is "finished" and all Units currently waiting at the assigned spots are released (Also their flags are reset). This Action is executed globally, which means that the assignable Units can be anywhere on the map. This ensures that especially in the beginning of the game (All) Units meet at a certain defined spot instead of rushing blindly into the enemy lines. This ensures a level of consistency and serves as a defensive mechanism as well (I.e. Zerg rushes). The spot that the Units are gathering is set by any extending subclass.
    Author:
    P H - 15.12.2017

                              javaGOAP.IGoapUnit groupMember)
        Description copied from interface: GroupableAction
        Function for actually performing the action as a group. This function is only called when mirroring the leader's action towards the other members of it's group and is not called for the leader himself.

        groupMember - the current Unit that is mirroring the leader's action.
